content:
Yes, here are some restaurants in Pomerania where you can try traditional dishes:

1. Restauracja Pod Lososiem - Located in the heart of Gdansk, this restaurant serves classic Polish cuisine, including pierogi, bigos, and kopytka.

2. Dom Polonii - This restaurant in Gdynia serves traditional Polish and Pomeranian dishes, including zrazy and kiszka. 

3. Pstrag Górski - This restaurant in Kaszuby specializes in fish dishes, such as trout and whitefish, as well as traditional Polish soups and stews.

4. Restauracja Galeria - This restaurant in Slupsk offers a variety of traditional Polish dishes, including pierogi, bigos, and smoked meat.

5. Przystań Marina - This restaurant in Gdansk offers a mix of traditional Polish and seafood dishes, including pierogi and fish soup.

These restaurants are just a few examples of the many places in Pomerania where you can try traditional Polish and Pomeranian cuisine. Be sure to explore the area and ask locals for their recommendations as well.
